page.title: 03EASTRIGGS HOUSING
page.content: Eastriggs was established during the First World War, so most of the houses were built between then and now. There are some older houses, about 150 years old, and mostly modernised, along the main road and north of the railway, about 70 altogether. A large munition works was built in 1916_17. Brick hostels built to house construction and process workers, were auctioned as terraced private houses in the early 1920's. There are about 275 such houses. Since the 2nd World War the Council has built at various times, a total of about 240 houses to let. Some have been bought by the tenants, under a law introduced in 1980. Since 1970, about 50 private houses have been built.Total number of houses _ about 635.
